GSILabs.BSystem

Interface EventLookupService


  • public interface EventLookupService
    This interface represents the functionality of finding an event given a partial description of it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Event[] searchEvent(java.lang.String eventName, java.lang.String locationName, java.lang.String performerName)
      Retrieves the list of events that match the information given as argument.

    • Method Detail

      • searchEvent

        Event[] searchEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                  java.lang.String locationName,
                  java.lang.String performerName)
        Retrieves the list of events that match the information given as argument. Note that the concatenation of the information is to be performed as an "and". This meaning that the inquirer is looking for events that have a name that looks like the eventName, held at a location whose name is similar to locationName and a performer like performerName. Hence, coincidences in all of the fields must be produced in order an event to be listed in the return value. Invokers are free to use an asterisk to represent the "any value". Of course, if all of the arguments are asterisks, the return value will be the complete list of events in the system.
        Parameters:
        eventName - The name of the event, or "*" if interested in all of them.
        locationName - The name of the location, or "*" if interested in all of them.
        performerName - The name of the performer, , or "*" if interested in all of them
        Returns:
        The list of events that match all of the information given in the arguments.
